T1.label: Defence Supercycle Winner
T1.description: DroneShield executes on growth strategy; earnings accelerate
T1.plain_english: DroneShield captures significant share of the multi-billion dollar counter-UAS market as Western militaries urgently build capability. Revenue growth sustains at 50%+ annualised with programme-of-record contracts.
T1.what_to_watch: Next earnings result and forward guidance.
T1.upside: Material re-rating if execution surprises to the upside.
T1.risk_plain: If growth disappoints, this narrative weakens.

T2.label: Lumpy Revenue, Not Scaling
T2.description: DroneShield delivers steady-state results; valuation holds
T2.plain_english: Revenue remains contract-dependent and volatile. Current growth reflects one-off orders, not a sustainable trajectory. Q3's A$92.9M may be a spike, not a baseline.
T2.risk_plain: If the base case is already priced in, limited upside from here.

T3.label: Competitive Displacement by Primes
T3.description: DroneShield faces headwinds; earnings or multiples compress
T3.plain_english: Major defence primes capture the counter-UAS market, marginalising DroneShield to niche applications. Scale, lobbying, and procurement relationships favour incumbents over time.
T3.what_to_watch: Cost pressures, competitive threats, or macro headwinds.
T3.risk_plain: Material downside if multiple risks crystallise simultaneously.

T4.label: US Market Penetration Succeeds
T4.description: A structural shift changes the investment case for DroneShield
T4.plain_english: DroneShield establishes itself as a key US DOD vendor, unlocking the world's largest defence market. AUKUS Pillar 2 creates bilateral procurement opportunities.
T4.what_to_watch: Industry disruption signals and regulatory changes.
T4.upside: See research report for upside scenario detail.
T4.risk_plain: If disruption materialises, prior assumptions become invalid.

big_picture: Counter-drone pure play riding the most significant shift in military doctrine since precision-guided munitions. Revenue surged 210% in 1H 2025, Q3 hit a record A$92.9M, and the company swung to EBITDA profit. Yet the stock has fallen 57% from peak: pipeline contracted A$2.55B to A$2.09B, US head resigned, directors selling shares, and the LAND156 ADF contract was not won.
